Hello,
I am trying to build a workflow using custom code, i want to use the HubSpot property 'updated by user id' and take that value (value shows name in HubSpot but actually an id) and compare it with the owners API and extract the info (basically the first name and last name) and paste the name in another property called 'updated by user'.
I have tried it several ways but so far not successful. Any ideas or findings ?

Hi, I'm currently getting familiar with workflows and the deployment of custom actions through our public app. To do so, I created the example action "Create Widget Example #2" using a POST request to <https://api.hubapi.com/automation/v4/actions/{{appId}}>. This action <https://developers.HubSpot.com/beta-docs/guides/api/automation/custom-workflow-actions#example-%232|should be available for all workflow types>.

However, this action is not being offered in the workflow editor in my test account connected to the app. In the action's definition, the `published` field is set to `false`. Is that why it isn't displayed in my test account? How can I test this action before publishing it?

<https://developers.HubSpot.com/beta-docs/guides/api/automation/custom-workflow-actions#test-and-publish-your-custom-action|The docs say>: "You can also test the action in your developer portal by creating a workflow in the workflows tool."

Is the "developer portal" the homepage of my developer account? Where can I find the "workflows tool" in it?

Apologies if these questions seem trivial, but I'm feeling a bit stuck right now.

OK, I’ve now found two old threads from 2023 about exactly the same issue:
• <https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/archives/C019VT42R8X/p1695978625443689>
• <https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/archives/C019VT42R8X/p1693575184354839>
The frustration with the unclear or outdated documentation existed more than a year ago.

So, I assume the solution is still the same: Unpublished actions cannot be tested. To test an action, it must be published. To ensure that users of the app cannot see the unfinished action, you need a second app that is only connected to your own test accounts.
I don‘t know why you wanna do this, but I think this property is set by HubSpot and you can‘t do this.
